title: Yesterday, today: the Netsilik eskimo
creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet and Gilles Blais
brief_description: Until the mid-1960s Zachary Itimignac and his family lived the nomadic life of the Inuit hunter in the Pelly Bay region of the Arctic. Then the Canadian government introduced measures to provide heated dwellings, a school, a hospital, medical care, a cooperative, air transportation, etc. This film is a day-long study of the impact of the changed way of life on this one family.
